filesystem.description: Could the command modify the filesystem? Examples: `rm`, `mv`.

other-processes.description: Could the command modify other processes? Examples: `kill`, `disown`.

component-command-info.description: Additional metadata for the component commands.

bash-type.description: The output of `type -t $COMMAND` in bash; one of `alias`, `keyword`, `function`, `builtin`, or `file`. May be different in other shells, e.g. `which` is a `builtin` in zsh but a `file` in bash.

debian.description: Information specific to the Debian Linux distribution.

executable-path.description: The full path to the binary. Often in e.g. `/bin/` or `/usr/bin/`.

required-packages.description: the Debian package(s) required to install the relevant command.

requirements-in-general.description: Requirements for a command in all possible uses. Useful for figuring out why a command doesn't work as expected.

authentication.description: Could the command require the user to enter their password? Examples: `chsh`, `passwd`.

internet-connection.description: Could the command require an active internet connection? Examples: `wget`, `whois`, `dig`.

sudo.description: Could the command require superuser priveleges? Examples: `shutdown`, `rtcwake`.

component-commands.description: List of the individual commands that make up the composite command. Required field.

authors.description: List of the people who wrote the CmdOyster, not necessarily the command itself.

license-name.description: Usually a free software license, such as GPL, BSD, or MIT.

license-url.description: Link to the text of the license, usually HTTP.

year.description: Year the CmdOyster was first written.

description.description: Textual description of what the command does. Must be unique, since its SHA1 hash is effectively the primary key. Required field.

nilsimsa-hex.description: A locality-sensitive hash, helping to detect similar descriptions.

sha1-hex.description: The SHA1 cryptographic hash of the description string; useful instead of a primary key for linking to related commands. Required field.

string.description: The actual text of the description. Don't add hard linebreaks; let the output formatter decide how to do that. Required field.

invocations.description: The possible forms a command can have. All invocations must have the same component commands. There must be at least one invocation.

comment.description: Explanation of what makes this invocation different from others.

changeable-arguments.description: Adjustable parameters of the command or commands.

additionalProperties.description: The actual text of the argument; a subset of the invocation string.

component-command.description: The argument is passed to this command.

component-command-flag.description: The argument is passed via this flag.

invocation-slice.description: Position of the argument in the invocation string that can be accessed by slice notation.

subtype.description: More refined type, e.g. type is string, subtype is absolute path.

type.description: The base type of the argument. Useful since e.g. JSON does not distinguish floats and integers.

command-requirements-as-invoked.description: Requirements for a command as its used in the invocation.

authentication.description: As used in this invocation, does the command require the user to enter their password?

internet-connection.description: As used in this invocation, does the command require an active internet connection?

sudo.description: As used in this invocation, does the command require superuser priveleges?

versions-tested.description: What versions is this invocation known to work for?

version-specifier.description: For this invocation, what version is required?

example-outputs.description: Example outputs of the command. Only include these if they are is short and provide insight into what the command does.

nilsimsa-hex.description: A locality-sensitive hash, useful for finding similar invocations.

items.description: Hashes of invocations for different commands that are related to this invocation. A kind of hyper-linking.

nilsimsa-hex.description: Nilsimsa hash of related invocation; useful if link is broken due to small change in invocation.

sha1-hex.description: The SHA-1 cryptographic hash of the command string; useful for linking to related commands. Required field.

shell-compatibility.description: Explains which shells are/aren't compatible with this invocation.

compatible-version-specifier.description: Specify the version(s) that the shell is compatible with for this invocation.

compatible-versions-tested.description: List of versions for the shell that are known to work with this invocation.

incompatible-version-specifier.description: Specify the version(s) that the shell is not compatible with for this invocation.

incompatible-versions-tested.description: List of versions for the shell that are known to fail or not work as expected for this invocation.

string.description: Actual string that could be passed to the shell and executed. Required field.

related-commands.description: Hashes of the descriptions of other commands that are related to this one, e.g. a command that accomplishes the same thing with different component commands.

nilsimsa-hex.description: String similarity hash of description of related command; useful if link is broken and description is only slightly different.

sha1-hex.description: Unique hash of description of related command.

relevant-urls.description: A list of URLs that discuss the command or an equivalent command with the same component commands.
